sourceMeaningMnemonic: The <radical>thread</radical> radical and <kanji>thread</kanji> are the same in looks as well as in meaning.
meaningInfo: This is why it's good to make sure you know your radicals.
readingMnemonic: You have some <kanji>thread</kanji>... what's the first thing you do with it? You take it and put it in your mouth, and start sucking it down like spaghetti. You have decided to <reading>eat</reading> (<ja>いと</ja>) the thread.
readingInfo: Think about how it tastes. Think about how it feels in your throat. Let it get caught on your teeth and around your tongue. It's a weird feeling having thread in your mouth, and you want to use that weird feeling to remember you're going to <reading>eat</reading> it.
